item.title: Falcon add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Falcon add a quote by James Madison
item.description: "I believe there are more instances of the abridgment of the freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments of those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations." -- James Madison

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "To punish me for my contempt for authority, fate made me an authority myself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "Authority, when first detecting chaos at its heels, will entertain the vilest schemes to save its orderly facade." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Stanley Milgram
item.description: "The disappearance of a sense of responsibility is the most far-reaching consequence of submission to authority." -- Stanley Milgram

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Criss Jami
item.description: "Time and time again does the pride of man influence his very own fall. While denying it, one gradually starts to believe that he is the authority, or that he possesses great moral dominion over others, yet it is spiritually unwarranted. By that point he loses steam; in result, he falsely begins trying to prove that unwarranted dominion by seizing the role of a condemner." -- Criss Jami

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Bruce Lee
item.description: "I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine." -- Bruce Lee

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Donald Miller
item.description: "When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are." -- Donald Miller

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I find my life is a lot easier the lower I keep my expectations." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Falcon add a quote by Alison McGhee
item.description: "You are most powerful when you are most silent. People never expect silence. They expect words, motion, defense, offense, back and forth. They expect to leap into the fray. They are ready, fists up, words hanging leaping from their mouths. Silence? No." -- Alison McGhee
